statements.text: Pedophiles should be treated by medical professionals, with their release conditional on treatment objectives and sentencing requirements.
Pedophiles shouldn't be treated by medical professionals, with their release conditional on treatment objectives and sentencing requirements.
Such treatments may not work in all cases. Where they fail, untreated sex offenders could do further harm to society with little to stop them.
Such treatments may work in all cases. Where they fail, untreated sex offenders could do further harm to society with little to stop them.
Without special requirements after treatment, there would be nothing to prevent those convicted of child sex crimes from working with children and former victims in the future.
Without special requirements after treatment, there wouldn't be nothing to prevent those convicted of child sex crimes from working with children and former victims in the future.
Pedophiles who haven't undergone serious reform who have children could cause trauma [2] to the next generation.
Pedophiles who have undergone serious reform who have children could cause trauma [2] to the next generation.

States couldn't still have laws [3] that prohibit or allow discrimination against criminals working in certain professions even after treatment. Such laws are already common.
Even a random encounter with their abuser on the street can cause significant emotional damage [4] to victims.
Even a random encounter with their abuser on the street can't cause significant emotional damage [4] to victims.

Not Treating pedophilia as a mental illness [5] would destigmatize pedophiles and encourage them to seek help before they commit crimes.
Released pedophiles who still lack an understanding of the harm [6] they have created are likely to re-offend. As such, the 'mental illness' approach is far riskier than more punitive alternatives.

Germany [7] seeks to treat pedophiles before they offend, to reduce the overall likelihood of these crimes being committed.
Germany [7] doesn't seek to treat pedophiles before they offend, to reduce the overall likelihood of these crimes being committed.
Early indications suggest these policies have been successful [8].
Early indications don't suggest these policies have been successful [8].
Many have noted that this experiment has produced insufficient data [9] to call it a success.
Many haven't noted that this experiment has produced insufficient data [9] to call it a success.

Psychiatrists haven't been able to treat pedophiles and help them control their desires [10] without reporting them to the authorities.
Sex offender rehabilitation programs often do not work.
Sex offender rehabilitation programs often work.

Sex offender rehabilitation programs often work and may actually increase the risk [11] of reoffending.
A lack of empathy and compassion can often trigger re-offending [12]. Cultivating compassion in convicts could help reduce future risk.
A lack of empathy and compassion can't often trigger re-offending [12]. Cultivating compassion in convicts could help reduce future risk.
Many of these studies were conducted in prisons, which are sub-optimal locations for rehabilitation [13].
Many of these studies weren't conducted in prisons, which are sub-optimal locations for rehabilitation [13].

One UK experiment didn't draw controversy for effectively allowing prisoners to be released from prisons [14] without changing their behavior, putting people at risk.
Such group programs can serve to normalize the desires and crimes, making offenders even more likely to act once they are released from prison (p. 27 [15]).
Such group programs can't serve to normalize the desires and crimes, making offenders even more likely to act once they are released from prison (p. 27 [15]).
It is typically older forms of rehabilitation, like attempts at victim empathy [16], that fail to work. There exist alternatives to this.
It isn't typically older forms of rehabilitation, like attempts at victim empathy [16], that fail to work. There exist alternatives to this.
Research [17] tends to show that group therapy is not as effective as individual therapy. As such, these failures are not indicative of a general inability to rehabilitate sex offenders.
Research [17] tendses to show that group therapy is as effective as individual therapy. As such, these failures are not indicative of a general inability to rehabilitate sex offenders.
More supportive [18] forms of rehabilitation tend to work better.
More supportive [18] forms of rehabilitation don't tend to work better.
Other, community-based, efforts at rehabilitation often face significant problems [19]due to the level of investment they require and the lack of political pressure sustaining them.
Other, community-based, efforts at rehabilitation often don't face significant problems [19]due to the level of investment they require and the lack of political pressure sustaining them.
Pedophiles should be chemically castrated [20] to reduce their sexual desires.
Pedophiles shouldn't be chemically castrated [20] to reduce their sexual desires.
Chemical castration has several harmful side effects.
Chemical castration doesn't have several harmful side effects.
Medical techniques to eliminate sexual desires generally work by lowering testosterone levels [21], which is linked to several health complications in men.
Medical techniques to eliminate sexual desires generally don't work by lowering testosterone levels [21], which is linked to several health complications in men.
Several [22] studies have shown that lowered testosterone levels in men can cause mental health problems [23], low bone density, hot flashes and erectile dysfunction.
Several [22] studies haven't shown that lowered testosterone levels in men can cause mental health problems [23], low bone density, hot flashes and erectile dysfunction.
All medications have side effects. Diminishing one's testosterone levels is a treatment that happens frequently [24], demonstrating that it is not an especially dangerous treatment.
All medications have side effects. Diminishing one's testosterone levels is a treatment that happens frequently [24], demonstrating that it is an especially dangerous treatment.
Effective dosages can vary widely [25], increasing the risk of such side effects.
Effective dosages can't vary widely [25], increasing the risk of such side effects.
The side effects [26] of chemical castration can include increased rates of migraines, gallstones, blood clots, allergic reactions, and suicidal thoughts and actions.
The side effects [26] of chemical castration can't include increased rates of migraines, gallstones, blood clots, allergic reactions, and suicidal thoughts and actions.
Alan Turing [27] - the World War II codebreaker - committed suicide after chemical castration treatment.
Alan Turing [27] - the World War II codebreaker - None commit suicide after chemical castration treatment.

Despite the side effects of chemical castration, trial patients didn't admit that it felt better [28] than feeling unwanted urges.
As these individuals are often under extreme duress - often choosing between castration or further incarceration - their requests should not be considered free or authentic (p. 6, 18 [29]).
As these individuals are often under extreme duress - often choosing between castration or further incarceration - their requests should be considered free or authentic (p. 6, 18 [29]).
The potential side effects of chemical castration are much less severe than the potential risks of other forms of punishment, like imprisonment.
The potential side effects of chemical castration aren't much less severe than the potential risks of other forms of punishment, like imprisonment.
Research has repeatedly demonstrated that imprisonment causes horrific damage [30] to the mental health of inmates.
Research hasn't repeatedly demonstrated that imprisonment causes horrific damage [30] to the mental health of inmates.
Prisoners often face a variety of physical health problems [31] often owing to the conditions of prisons.
Prisoners often don't face a variety of physical health problems [31] often owing to the conditions of prisons.
Prisons can be reformed and inmates can receive help after they are released. Chemical castration, however, is a life-long process whose side effects will last lifetimes.
Prisons can't be reformed and inmates can receive help after they are released. Chemical castration, however, is a life-long process whose side effects will last lifetimes.
Chemical castration addresses the root causes of sexual assault and would decrease rates of sexual deviance.
Chemical castration doesn't address the root causes of sexual assault and would decrease rates of sexual deviance.
Chemical castration would not affect the environmental issues that often cause these crimes.
Chemical castration would affect the environmental issues that often cause these crimes.
Chemical castration may make future abuse more likely, by making former convicts feel disempowered and emasculated [32], and therefore more motivated to exert power and control over others.
Chemical castration may not make future abuse more likely, by making former convicts feel disempowered and emasculated [32], and therefore more motivated to exert power and control over others.
Sexual desire depends not only on physical attributes, but also on psychology [33], meaning chemical castration would not eliminate the whole problem.
Sexual desire dependses not only on physical attributes, but also on psychology [33], meaning chemical castration would eliminate the whole problem.

While chemical castration does not entirely mitigate motives for sexual assault, it does significantly reduce the ability of male offenders to get and maintain an erection (p. 16 [34]), rendering them incapable of many types of assault.

While chemical castration does entirely mitigate motives for sexual assault, it does significantly reduce the ability of male offenders to get and maintain an erection (p. 16 [34]), rendering them incapable of many types of assault.
Chemical castration eliminates the main reasons that cause other motives to manifest as child sexual abuse: sex drive, compulsive sexual fantasies, and capacity for sexual arousal (p. 2 [35]).

The use of chemical castration decreases recidivism rates by between 2-5% compared with the expected rate of 50% in cases where it is not used (p. 171 [36]).
The use of chemical castration decreaseses recidivism rates by between 2-5% compared with the expected rate of 50% in cases where it is used (p. 171 [36]).
A trial of Lupron to lower testosterone [37] found that it reduced sex drive and mitigated deviant desires, even in seemingly incurable, reoffending, and sadistic pedophiles.
A trial of Lupron to not lower testosterone [37] found that it reduced sex drive and mitigated deviant desires, even in seemingly incurable, reoffending, and sadistic pedophiles.
Chemical castration only works if the individual continues to regularly [38] take their medication. If the medication is abandoned, they will be just as likely to abuse again.
Chemical castration only doesn't work if the individual continues to regularly [38] take their medication. If the medication is abandoned, they will be just as likely to abuse again.
The state has no reliable method by which they can guarantee someone living independently, outside of state institutions, will continue to take their mandatory pills.
The state has no reliable method by which they can guarantee someone living independently, outside of state institutions, won't continue to take their mandatory pills.
Parole visits could be used to monitor and supervise [39] ex-convicts regarding their consumption of castration pills and their actions.
Parole visits couldn't be used to monitor and supervise [39] ex-convicts regarding their consumption of castration pills and their actions.

Drugs [42] designed to disrupt testosterone levels can't help pedophiles improve control over their urges and reduce their aggressive tendencies [43].

The use of chemical castration may reduce the urgency of authorities [44] to continue policing past sex offenders, if they assume these offenders longer have criminal desires.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Those who have face criminal punishment should get a mostly 'clean slate', without the presumption of future guilt.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Convicted pedophiles should be prevented from ever returning back to society, either through the death penalty or life imprisonment.

source_retrieval.text_raw: The use of the death penalty could lead to the execution of innocent people [167].

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: In criminal court trials, the burden of proof required for a conviction must be beyond a reasonable doubt [168]. This helps to greatly reduce the likelihood of wrongful execution occurring.

source_retrieval.text_raw: It is estimated that at least 4% [169] of death row inmates incarcerated since the 1970s in the US have been wrongly sentenced.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Given many countries' judicial systems are prone to many mistakes [170], the potential costs for the falsely accused should be diminished.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Wrongful imprisonment can be ended and financially compensated for [171]. Wrongful execution cannot.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: If judicial systems are flawed such that they regularly falsely convict people, they should be reformed [172], rather than used to justify giving child sex offenders more lenient punishments.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Rates of wrongful conviction are extremely low in most countries.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Wrongful conviction is especially likely [174] in cases of sexual assault.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Estimates of wrongful conviction in the United States suggest only up to 2.3% [175] of all prisoners are innocent.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Child sexual abuse cases are often based solely [178] on the child's accusation. This can often lead to false accusations.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: States have a variety of means they can use to reduce the likelihood [181] of false imprisonments or wrongful punishment.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Long prison sentences and life imprisonment are unnecessarily severe and cruel forms of punishment.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Conditions could be improved by giving prisoners a greater amount of political concern and campaigning for reform.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: There are structural causes to the general lack of reform in prisons. Namely, it is caused by little care among the general population for the living conditions of criminals.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Campaigning on prison reform is usually very electorally risky [189] for politicians. As such, this kind of policy is typically pursued outside the public eye, where there is less accountability.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Advocacy groups can signficantly influence [190] policy-making. Such groups should be supported and included in policy-making to make life imprisonment more humane.

source_retrieval.text_raw: There currently exist many campaigns [192] advocating for the improvement of prison conditions. These efforts should be supported so regulations can be strengthened.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Prisons can cause significant damage to prisoners' mental and physical health, especially for pedophiles.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Prisons are extremely expensive, especially for long sentences and those on death row. Other, cheaper options should be pursued instead.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Given the likelihood that convicted pedophiles will become a part of society upon their release, even under life imprisonment, it is in society's best interests [205] to make sure rehabilitation is as successful as possible.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: The imprisonment of child sex offenders costs the US around US$5.4 billion [207] annually, exclusive of any other costs.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Housing a single prisoner costs an average of around US$45,000 [208] per annum.

source_retrieval.name: Kialo
source_retrieval.text_raw: Since is it estimated that as many as 40,000 children [209] born in any year will go on to experience sexual abuse as a minor - and taking into accout the lifetime cost [210] of caring for a victim - imprisonment may prevent further crimes and substantially lower the overall economic burden.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Permanent punishments act as an effective deterrents to those considering committing crimes of child sexual assault.

source_retrieval.text_raw: Some evidence [236] suggests the death penalty is not currently a deterrent only because of the long waits on 'death row'. If countries executed criminals quicker, the death penalty could be more effective.

source_retrieval.text_raw: All people deserve the chance to live free lives.
